snippet: The changes would lower the threshold required to find someone guilty and would bring the university in line with the rest of the Ivy League.
abstract: Princeton University is planning significant changes in the way it handles allegations of sexual misconduct, including lowering standards required for guilty finding in disciplinary proceedings; changes would bring Princeton's procedures in line with those at peer institutions and in compliance with federal requirements.
lead_paragraph: The changes would lower the threshold required to find someone guilty and would bring the university in line with the rest of the Ivy League.

headline.main: Princeton Faculty to Vote on Altering Sexual Misconduct Policies
headline.print_headline: Princeton Nears Vote to Alter Sexual Misconduct Rules
